course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Foundational Texts in the Humanities: Aristotle x Mencius - The Basic Concepts of Logic and Rhetoric
course.description: Aristotle was the founder of formal logic and many other fields of knowledge. His theory of syllogism has had a great influence on the history of Western thought. Mencius and Aristotle were contemporaries. Mencius is an argumentative yet ethical thinker; the book of Mencius provides us with logical and persuasive debates on virtues and human nature. For both Aristotle and Mencius, the logic of arguments and the art of rhetoric are the chief weapons in the service of truth. In this course, we explore: (a) the basic concepts of logical thinking and the art of rhetoric, and (b) the cultural and philosophical values exhibited and implicit in Mencius and Aristotle's logical works.

reviews.author: YHK
reviews.title: Good Course Ever in HKUST
reviews.comment_content:
Logic, Fallacy and Rhetoric, with less emphasis on the rhetoric part.  

And there are three optional tutorials talking about some extra topics beyond the scope.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Yip is a very patient and interactive professor.  Even though the course doesn't take attendance for grading, I guess there are more than 80% students attending each of the class.
reviews.comment_grading:
3 quizzes: 75%
1 final essay: 25%

The quizzes are quite easy and it is in multiple choice format.  As long as you have spent some hours on them, you will get a descent results :)

The first quiz is cancelled due to the typhoon issue and everyone got full mark for that.
Second Quiz: Above 0.5 sd
Third Quiz: Above 1 sd
Final Essay: Above 0.5 sd

Turns out to be A. So it is definitely a good grading course :)
reviews.comment_workload:
Light workload compared with other huma course I would say.

There are no mandatory tutorials and assignments for the whole course.  All you have to do is to attend the lectures and try to digest the content, spending some leisure time to read through the materials. That's it.

reviews.author: KHAA
reviews.comment_content:
***Lectures are conducted in Cantonese.
Lecture:
Week 1: Introduction—What logic is? What rhetoric is?
Week 2: The Intellectual Background of Aristotle’s philosophy
Week 3 & 4: Topics —Aristotle on Logic and Language
Week 5 & 6: Prior Analytics—Aristotelian logic
Week 7 & 8: Modern logic—Propositional calculus
Week 9: Sophistical Refutations—Aristotle on Fallacies
Week 10 & 11: A New Classification of Fallacies
Week 12: The Intellectual Background of Mencius’ philosophy
Week 13: Mencius’ Art of Rhetoric
(Week 1-4: Quiz 1, Week 5-8: Quiz 2, Week 9-13: Quiz 3)

Tutorial:
Tutorial 1:God
Tutorial 2:happiness
Tutorial 3:Mencius’s (孟子) claim
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lecture: interesting, many examples are given to explain the content of lecture notes.
Tutorial: Optional, there are three tutorials in the semester. Also, there are several quiz review sections.
Reading material: quite a lot, 2-3 articles each week, example: 邏輯導論, 邏輯的觀念...
Supplementary exercise: Propositional Logic exercise(Quiz 2), Syllogism exercise(Quiz 2) and Fallacy exercise(Quiz 3)
Writing Report:
Professor Yip and TAs offered an essay consultation for students to give advice on their essay.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quiz (25%*3)+Writing report (25%)
Quiz 1: Mean:25 (cancelled, Everyone get full marks.)
Quiz 2: Mean:10.9, SD=5.45
Quiz 3: Mean:17.9, SD=2.8
Writing report: Mean:17.4, SD=2.62

Quiz 2: Mean+1.3SD
Quiz 3: Mean+0.9SD
Writing report: Mean+2.5SD
Final Grade: A+ (87.5/90)

Generally speaking, Grading is quite good.
It is better to do supplementary exercise before quiz.
reviews.comment_workload:
3 Quizzes and 1 Essay
Quiz:
All quizzes are MC questions. It takes about 25-30 minutes.
Essay:
Two people form in group for writing a 1000+-50 words essay about fallacy in either Chinese or English.

reviews.author: PS_1113
reviews.comment_content: The course covered mostly logic, including some some traditional rules and theories in logic and modern logic. A few lectures covered rhetoric in the context of Mencius and some other Chinese philosopher.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor tried to discuss with the whole class, explaining the ideas with the use of latest news and examples which are easy to understand. Professor and TAs are also very willing to answer questions both in class and after class.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair grading. Mean score in quizzes and assignment would give you a B-.
reviews.comment_workload: Multiple quizzes and one writing assignment. But readings are recommended (though not compulsory).

reviews.author: TCheung
reviews.title: A good grade Cantonese course
reviews.comment_content: Introduction of some basic concept, e.g. Ambiguity (歧義), Vagueness (含糊), Syllogism (三段論), Venn Diagram, Validity, True-table method, Fallacy (謬誤), etc..
reviews.comment_teaching:
I would say Prof Yip has passion and using Cantonese really helps our understanding of the materials.

Nevertheless, much of class time was not lecturing - either letting people to ask questions, or talking about the news. So she only covered few materials throughout the semester.
reviews.comment_grading:
25% - Everyone automatically get full marks
50% - Quizzes (Best 2 out of 4)
25% - Essay

Overall mean 81.5/100
Stat (Mean, Median, SD):
- Quiz 1 (18.0, 18.5, 4.09)
- Quiz 3 (17.6, 17.5, 3.57)
- Quiz 4 (16.5, 17, 4.48)
- Optional Quiz (17.0, 17.5, 4.27)
- Essay (17.8, 18, 3.14)

Examples (might not be cut-off):
92.5/100 → A
87/100 → A-
84.5/100 → B+
82/100 → B-
reviews.comment_workload:
The only workload are from the four quizzes and essay.

For the essay, 2 people form a group and need to write 1000 words for a particular fallacy or class of fallacy, by giving examples and illustration.

Quiz 2 was cancelled, but there was another optional quiz.

Only the best two quizzes were counted. Except for quiz 4, there was a short-question, others are MC. Even you learn nothing about this course, you can use your common sense to answer most of the questions.

reviews.author: EdisonCHAN
reviews.comment_content:
***Cantonese is the medium of the course***

Content involve Logic and Language, Syllogism, Modern Logic, Fallacies , Rhetoric and Background of Aristotle and Mencius
---
The concept of logic is not difficult to understand, but it is not easy to be applied on quiz.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The course basically has Lecture only. The tutorial is optional but I recommend you to go since it is interesting.
The Lecture is not boring at all ,and the instructor and TA are helpful. They are willing to answer student's question after lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
75% Quiz (Best 3 out of 4 Quiz, 25% each)
25% Writing essay (group of 2) about fallacy

The Quiz in fact is not difficult, but it is easy to make mistake. And many people are obtain high mark.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is light. No final, No midterm, No HW
Only one group (2 people) writing essay and few MC quizzes are needed.

reviews.author: yofung_tw
reviews.comment_content:
Most of the class is about logic (Aristotle) while at the very end of the course it is about Mencius.
Lots of reading are given. Some quizzes may include very few question on the reading.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching is clear.
In some lessons, most of the time is student discussing or challenging the professor. It is quite confusing during that class.
Cantonese.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quizzes below mean and Essay above mean, got a C.
The cut off of B range is like 1 mark difference leading to 1 sub- grade difference.
Quizzes are quite tricky. Most of the quizzes are given in all MC questions. If you get wrong answer, mark will be deducted. Different mark deduction is given in different section of the quiz. Sometimes, even if you get all the questions correct in the second section, mark deduction in the first section made you below mean.
reviews.comment_workload:
3 out of 4 Quizzes(25 marks for each) should be counted (one quiz is cancelled and everyone get 25/25, another optional quiz is given in study break)
Quizzes contribute a lot to the final grading due to no exam.
Essay(25 marks) with one partner of 1000 words (you can write it in either Chinese or English).
